title:
The Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) has warned that climate change is already affecting Liberia’s weather patterns, as the country continues to experience rainfall during what should be the dry season.

Liberia traditionally has six months of rainy season and six months of dry season, but EPA officials say the unusual weather this year signals growing climate disruptions. The agency is urging collective action to protect the environment and reduce the impact of climate change nationwide.

By:Daniel Theophilus Cole | Kool
